title: WCAS ECON 101-6-50 First-Year Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The goal of this course will be to learn the basic tools of game theory and use them to explore various topics including sports, politics, and evolutionary biology. During class students will participate in "economic experiments" where they will interact strategically with each other to see how well theory matches actual outcomes. We will discuss what such experiments reveal about economic models of decision-making and strategic interaction.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 80-minute classes per week. Students are expected to participate in interactive strategic games.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, smaller written assignments, final paper.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
The Sense of Style (Steven Pinker); ISBN-13: 978-0670025855
The Righteous Mind (Jonathan Haidt); ISBN-13: 978-0307455772
Other reading material will be provided.
